intro: Ascyrum spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved ascyrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spoon-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its aromatic foliage and showy inflorescences make it a notable species in botanical studies. It serves as a food source for various pollinators and is valued for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity.
